Flare ??A? Wildfork Gas Plant
Frisco City, AL


EXECUTIVE SUMMARY


Introduction and Policies

Wildfork Gas Plant, owned and operated by American Midstream Partners, LP ("American Midstream") is committed to safety and environmental excellence.  This philosophy involves making each and every employee and contractor accountable for their own safety as well as that of the community around them.  As a company, we follow a close adherence to all applicable federal, state and local laws to ensure a safe and healthy environment for all. 

Employees who enter the Wildfork facility complete a thorough training, both in the classroom and on-the-job, that enables them to address emergency issues as they arise.  This preparation includes standard operational, emergency operational, and release prevention training.  In addition, periodic refresher courses help to keep operators' problem solving abilities up to date and in sync with our recurring safety improvements.  Our regular internal audits provide an excellent checks and balances system for monitoring these high standards that we set.

Wildfork Gas Plant is an unmanned natural gas liquid extraction LP-Gas Processing facility with LP-Gas mixture and LP-Gas storage and sales to wholesale markets.  The site is comprised of 35,000 and 30,000-gallon NGL (Natural gas liquids) storage tanks and a 1,000-gallon propane storage tank with the associated fixtures (e.g. piping).  Propane and NGL are the regulated substances handled at the facility.  There are no toxic substances present at the plant above threshold quantities.  The facility is classified as Program Level 2 under the regulation.  The purpose of this Risk Management Plan (RMPlan) is to provide information about our operations at the facility, our programs to prevent accidental chemical releases, our emergency response plans in case an accidental release should occur, our 5 year accident history, and our planned changes to improve safety at the facility.

Prevention Progr

am

The Wildfork Gas facility complies with the EPA's accidental release prevention rule and applicable state and local codes and regulations.  This natural gas liquid extraction processing and liquefied petroleum gas handling and storage facility is designed, installed, and maintained in accordance with NFPA-58 and state law utilizing ASME, ANSI, and API codes and guidance.  This facility has in place an active SPCC plan developed in accordance with 40 CFR 112.7.

Five-year Accident History

No incident resulting in onsite or offsite impacts from a hydrocarbon release has occurred at the Wildfork Plant within the last five years.  Although we take pride in that record, we also place daily emphasis on our prevention and safety programs to ensure this record continues.



Emergency Response Program

In the event of an emergency involving our natural gas liquid extraction LP-Gas handling and storage facility system, it is our policy to notify the Frisco City Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency.  We have discussed this policy with the Monroe County Emergency Response manager and he has inspected our facility.


Planned Changes to Improve Safety

No improvement are planned to date.
